text: In today's video we are going to talk about CSS Box Model In any element, content is the same then margin, border and padding This border, margin and padding is the concept of CSS Box Model In this video we will understand all these things and see how to set margin, border, padding in CSS So let's go to the computer screen I'm really very excited Let's roll the intro Music So guys I'm in my computer screen and the first thing I'm going to do is I'm going to show you a playlist and you guys don't click on star and you don't even access it you can do that click on star and then click on access and I've also added source code you can also access it and I want you to enjoy that too so what you can do while enjoying this I've made a folder here and I'll open it with code as you can see and it will open in VS Code if you don't have open with code option which many people tell me that we don't have open with code option so I have an idea for you guys that you can install VS Code and run its setup again and see which options I've checked now I'll come to the video and I'll make a file named index.html and I'll put a boilerplate template and I'll write here CSS box model after writing CSS box model I'll create a style tag with the help of which I'll... oops, how did I create a style tag is it too fast guys? no, it's not fast so while creating a style tag I'll add styles here and I'll tell you how the box model works in CSS so first of all let's understand the concept of the box model in CSS what is the concept of box model in CSS in CSS everything is a box whatever elements we've made from HTML they are all a box whether we've made a container, a div or a span they are all a box in CSS and inside that box there are some things which I want to show you so if you can see in the computer screen you'll see that I've explained the concept of CSS box model CSS box model means outside your content is padding outside it is border and outside it is margin so this concept should come to you one more thing I want to tell you is that I've made a div.box I'll write I am a box and if I show you its preview it'll be like this this is my box outside this box there is some margin and padding which you'll know when I'll add a background to it so I'll simply write .box which means class selector, I've selected the box and if I add background color to it let us say aqua so the background color of this box will be aqua we can write the format document so that we'll get good formatting now you can see here some margin padding I'll use a universal selector our browser plays smart it says that the developer doesn't have a brain so I'll use my brain and it adds margin padding and other styles so now we need to reset the CSS so here I've written star and write m colon 0 so margin is 0 and p colon 0 so padding is 0 and by doing this it'll stick to the top so I've written I am a box so let's do one thing I'll write I am a box and here I'll write div.box and I can add multiple classes by doing box1 and box2 so I've written div.box1 and here I've written box2 so whatever properties I'll select will be applied to this element and this element because we can add multiple classes to one element as I told you earlier one element can be added multiple classes and here I've added box1 and box2 and here I'll simply write I am another box this was box1 and this is box2 now what I'll do in box2 I'll write div.box2 and div.box1 now you understand what I've done I'll write the property which I want to give to both the boxes or suppose I have 10 boxes so I'll want to give them in 10 I'll write that as div.box and some properties which I'll individually want to give to both the boxes so I'll give this box1 class and this box2 class and if we want to give more classes to any element we'll apply space can we give more IDs to any element let me know in the comment section below let me see how much understanding you've got make a two way interaction can we add more IDs to one element by applying spaces let me know in the comment section below I'll confirm this now you see here I've written div.box1 so suppose I've made color yellow by doing this I'll make it red so here it'll be yellow and here it'll be red let me show you here it's yellow and here it's red now what does box model say it says that the content of CSS will be here, outside of it will be padding outside of it will be border and outside of it will be margin and the total height or width of any element will be added so much space will be filled total height and width means whatever space will be filled so you should know this so this is what we've seen in box model so I've added different classes now what I'll do I'll say in box1 I'll add some padding and I want to add 10px padding so if I add 10px padding then 10px padding will be added from all sides and to see this you can right click and inspect pay attention to this you see here if I right click and inspect you can see here, I've removed my head I hope you can see it so here you can see box and box1 if I hover over box1 then only this element is selected look up and if I hover over it then only box2 is selected so by clicking on box1 this element is selected and I can come here so I've removed it now by coming here I can see everything about it, color yellow I can change this color temporarily because its source code is written here so here I'll change it to permanent here I'll change it to temporary so now I'll do as I'm telling you I can preview by changing it to temporary how it'll look if my box color is white I'll reload it and it's fine again and I'll come here to computed as I come to computed I can see a box and this is the same box which I've shown on codewithhari.com so with this type of box I can see the width and height of this particular element and its padding I've given 10 padding I've given it from all sides no borders, no margins so we've given it in this element let's add a border so I've added padding I'm doing it in box1 only remember I'm doing it in box1 only as I come back now I'll add margin and I'll add margin of 5px and as I add margin what will happen that it'll look outside the element so the background of the element won't be retained what does it mean it means suppose I've applied pink color on you suppose I've applied pink color on you so you'll be pink but if I've applied pink, pink, pink on you it won't look like that so this was a weird example but I'll tell you that outside the content if you've applied padding the background color will also be in the area of padding because padding is applied from inside the content and margin is applied outside the content outside the element content is inside the element this is the content of the element so the background color will be in the area of padding not in the area of margin you have to keep this in mind so I've applied margin, so you can see the margin of 5px now I'll tell you how to add border if I write border I'll tell you later but for now if I write border 2px solid blue then the border of 2px is here and here you can see that I've given the border of 2px you can see that the border is here you can see that the border is here so you can see this border and you can see that this is my content and this is the border so here we have a dpi factor in our display so you can see the actual border separately but this is pretty much how you can see the margin, border and padding in real time so I hope you understood this now I'll tell you how to calculate the width of your element now let's say I've given its width or its height let's say 200px so I've given 200px and its height is 200px now I'll inspect it and I'll take you to the computed values so its height is 200px and you can see as I've kept the content on the arrow it's showing the content, padding border, margin and so on now you can see that the actual height of this element is 200px then 10 will connect to it and 10 will connect from below, it'll be 220px then the borders will connect and then the margin will connect so as soon as I connect all these things then all the space will be created but the height of a particular element or its width the total width and height is derived from this formula that we'll connect both the widths left and right padding, left and right border and left and right margin so this is the total width I hope you understood this and if I just talk about the element how much space it's connecting to the border then you'll connect all these things but now I want to tell you that if I put a CSS property which I can directly add in styles I'll show you if I do background red, it'll get red temporarily until I reload but I'll put it here here I'll write box sizing and border box as soon as I write box sizing and border box you'll see that its actual width sorry height is 176 176.8 is because 176.8 plus 20 is 196.8 and after that the border will be 200 we don't include margin here because margin is outside margin is not included whenever we set a height and we put box sizing property try to understand when I say its height is 200 or width is 200 so if I didn't put this with width 200 box sizing and border box listen to this very carefully if I didn't put box sizing and border box then what will happen then the actual content or width is 200 I'll explain it with height example 200 will be the content height then if you add the total space then it'll add padding, then border but if I say box sizing and border box then I'm basically saying that it includes border and padding but not margin it doesn't include margin I'm saying 200 box sizing and border box means that the height of my element is my height border and padding I've written both together meaning that content plus border plus padding should be 200 when I say box sizing and border box then I'm saying this if I write box sizing and border box then what am I saying I'm saying with CSS that hey CSS God the height I'm giving you I'm giving you padding and border together meaning content plus border plus padding that's 200 this is the meaning of my height so box sizing and border box changes the height definition first definition of height is that padding won't be included it won't be included in the list it'll only be the height of this element as you can see here I'll remove this from here by the way I can also remove it from here I'll uncheck box sizing and border box then it'll be 200 then I'll add this then this so after adding both its total height will be 200 plus 20, 220 plus borders all its calculated borders but here I want to tell you about box sizing and border box so what happens as soon as I write box sizing and border box its height will be reduced and it'll be adjusted in such a way that it'll be 200 by adding padding and border I hope that makes a lot of sense I hope I explained it to you so this was a very important concept which I wanted to tell you all and now the concept I'm going to tell you you'll enjoy it because in that I'll tell you about margin collapse and this concept you should definitely know so I'll show you again this was our code I gave you 5px margin suppose I give you exactly the same in border 2 and let's increase the margin to make it better let's increase the margin to 25px and suppose I'll keep same to same things I'll keep color red of other element and I'll make its border black so that all other values are same you can see it in this box now tell me with honesty that margin is 10, 10, 10, 10 on all sides of this box so here we have this space should it be double or not think again and tell me that margin on all sides if I select this element then it'll be 25, 25, 25 not 10, 10, 25 25, 25, 25 and this element is also 25 so this distance should be 50 see 25 is this much see my arrow and this is also 25 so this is also 25 why not 50, it should be of upper element and lower element here comes the concept of margin collapse what is this concept of margin collapse concept of margin collapse says that if two elements are overlapping then the maximum margin will only be once suppose I have given 25 margin and this is 25 margin how much is the maximum between 25 and 25 if both are equal then 25 margin will be once if I make one of them 35 then 35 is 25 so this difference will be 35 so this is called margin collapse so if I show you a good example of margin collapse in images then I'll get an image which I can explain so basically suppose I have a box A and a box B this image is very good suppose I have a box A and a box B I have given 30 pixel margin in box A and 20 pixel margin in box B so it won't look like this but like this because the maximum space between these two will be once so this is how the margin will be so this is called margin collapse so I hope you understood this concept what is margin collapse what is the box model of CSS how the box model works and I tried to explain it to you very well how is the concept of margin collapse which bothers many CSS developers I know people like this who tell me that is CSS bad why is my margin looking wrong all these things you don't say so understand the concept of margin collapse and once you understand the concept of margin collapse then you will enjoy it then your development will be so smooth when you have to apply box sizing what will happen if you apply it what will not happen if you don't apply it especially when we convert Figma files in HTML, CSS, JavaScript then you will get the answer whether you have to apply box sizing or not I hope you are enjoying this course and I hope you are understanding these things if you haven't accessed this playlist yet then do it click here and bookmark and click here and save I am updating the source code so you will get the source code I hope you are enjoying the source code time to time update so like the video, access the playlist subscribe the channel and share the channel and in the next video thank you so much for watching this video and I will see you next time BYE
